sponsor.partnerMessage: Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Our patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. We prioritize listening to and caring for our patients to build long-term relationships with them and help them reach their dental goals. Learn more here.

posts.title: Where Can You Get a Vaccine?
posts.content:
Now that everyone in Arkansas is eligible for the vaccine, the next question is when and where can I get one? On Tuesday, the NWA Council announced plans to host weekly vaccination clinics in Benton and Washington Counties, through April 16.

  • The first Washington County clinic was held yesterday at at Donald W. Reynolds Razorback Stadium. The next mass vaccination will be in Fayetteville on April 7 at the Northwest Arkansas Mall.

  • The Benton County clinic this week is today from 8am to 4pm J.B. Hunt Corporate Headquarters in Lowell, Building C. Register HERE.

  • The Pfizer vaccine will be given at all NWA Council clinics. Second doses will be available at the same location three weeks after the first dose.
    Walk-ins will also be accepted, subject to availability.

For more information, visit nwacouncil.org/nwavaccines.

posts.title: Springdale's Teslar Named One of the "Best Fintechs to Work For"
posts.content:
A Springdale-based fintech company has been named to the American Banker‚Äôs list of the ‚ÄòBest Fintechs to Work For‚Äô in 2021. This is the first time any Arkansas based company has been recognized.

  • Springdale-based Teslar Software, which provides portfolio management tools for community banks, earned the no. 21 spot on American Banker‚Äôs list. Little Rock-based Smiley Technologies was named the second-best fintech to work for in the United States.

  • What is fintech and who is Teslar? ‚ÄúTeslar Software provides a fulfilling professional experience combined with an enjoyable employee experience... ‚ÄúWe have a family-style environment and every one of our team members is passionate about providing our customers with the technology they need to help the individuals and businesses in their communities thrive,‚Äù said Rachael Carter, VP of client advocacy at Teslar Software. Arkansas Money & Politics

  • Last fall, Teslar partnered with 50 small regional banks to help process PPP loans and manage the debt forgiveness process. Ultimately, assisting with putting money back into the community and keeping the lights on for small businesses.

You can read more about the Springdale company HERE

posts.title: Hop to It! Your Easter Weekend Guide in NWA
posts.content:
Easter is already upon us, and NWA is blooming - whether you're hiding eggs or headed to brunch, here is what we will be doing this weekend:

Fayetteville

  • Ella's Table is hosting an Easter Brunch on Sunday, April 4th from 11am to 4pm.
  • Atlas the Restaurant will be featuring a four course tasting menu on Sunday, April 4th.
  • The Razorback Football team will be hosting the second scrimmage of the spring at Razorback Stadium, open to all fans.
  • Experience Fayetteville will have their Outdoor Recreation Area pop-up lounge tonight and all day tomorrow.

Bentonville

  • Bentonville's 5th Annual Community Easter Egg Hunt will take place on 4/3, starting at 10:30am.
  • Tavola Trattoria is offering takeout specials all Easter weekend Friday to Sunday.
  • The Hub Bike Lounge is hosting a party this weekend to launch its new Dirt Surfer IPA and to giveaway a MTB!
  • Peel Compton is hosting a native tree and plant sale tomorrow.

Rogers

  • Mirabella's Table has a full Easter dinner menu available Friday, April 2nd and Saturday, April 3rd.
  • Cave Springs market will be hosting a family friendly easter egg hunt tomorrow.

Springdale

  • Infiniti Athletics in Springdale will be hosting an Easter Egg Glow in the Dark Hunt today, 4/2, starting at 6:30pm.
  • Springdale's Shaw Park is also set to open this weekend.

Easter Weekend Specials

  • Kindness & Joy Toys will have custom and personalized Easter baskets for kids of all ages and plenty of items to put in your existing Easter baskets.
  • Zuzu's Petals and Gifts is offering special flowers for Easter and custom Easter baskets ready for you or build-your-own baskets!
  • Bake It Til You Make It NWA has custom Easter cookies available.
  • Neighbor's Mill Bakery & Cafe is offering Easter Cakes and Hot Cross buns along with Easter cookies, DIY Easter kits and Easter Boxes.

posts.title: Hot Air Balloons on the Horizon
posts.content:
Yet another exciting event is on the horizon for Fayetteville - Open Avenues has announced plans to host the 2021 SOAR NWA hot air balloon festival on Saturday, Aug. 28 at Drake Field.

  • ‚ÄúWe are so excited to be able to bring this exciting and unique event back to Northwest Arkansas,‚Äù said Kelly Sampson, Development Director at Open Avenues. ‚ÄúWe had to cancel last year due to COVID, but as things are turning around we‚Äôre beginning to plan for an incredible return in 2021.‚Äù -Fayetteville Flyer

  • The event will feature hot air ballon activities (weather permitting), aeronautic events, circus performers, a kid zone, car exhibit, live entertainment, beer garden, food trucks, a ‚Äúballoon glow,‚Äù and more.

  • Proceeds will benefit Open Avenues, a local nonprofit that provides employment opportunities for people with disabilities. Tickets are $15 for adults and $5 for kids 10 and under. Rides and some activities at the event will be available for purchase.

For more information, read the full article HERE.

posts.title: New Public Art Installation Coming Soon to Downtown Bentonville
posts.photoCredit: NWA Daily (OZ Art NWA mural in Springdale)
posts.content:
OZ Art NWA and Justkids are teaming up to to bring California artist Ouizi to Bentonville for the design and installation of a new public mural.

  • Ouizi began work on the mural early this week. The public art piece will be located in downtown Bentonville on the corner of Main and 2nd Streets and will take about two weeks to complete.

  • ‚ÄúI am delighted and humbled to return to Bentonville to paint a new mural in the town square,‚Äù Ouizi said. ‚ÄúWhen I was last here painting inside Crystal Bridges, it was Summer, so I look forward to seeing the city in the Spring!‚Äù -5 News

  • Louise Jones (n√©e Chen), aka Ouizi, was born and raised in Santa Monica, CA to Shanghainese parents. She is best known for her large scale floral mural installations which can be seen in public spaces throughout the United States, from museums to public parks.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• 50 years of bridge: Some NWA retired friends meet face-to-face for the first time in over a year to play a game of bridge.

  • Going green: The Walton Family Foundation is bringing more than 6,500 trees to Benton County. In total, they
    will provide over $1.3 million to plant 1,192 new trees and give away 5,375 trees to residents.

  • Inside Scoop: Want to get the scoop how major retailers do their job? Walmart has released its Sales & Replenishment Trends Report for 2020.

  • Work with us: Want to feature your business in our newsletter? Check out the variety of advertising options on our website.
